div: One way to recalibrate is by navigating to the Peak Manager tab on the bottom tools tabs of the window, selecting ID Nuclides so that the application can identify what it deems to be appropriate nuclides for your given spectrum, navigating to the Energy Calibration tab also on the bottom tools tabs, and then checking/unchecking under "Calib. Peak" the nuclides the application identified that you are in agreement with; checked boxes classify the identity of the nuclide as "true," unchecked boxes classify the identity as "false."

div.ul: You can still manually change the calibration parameters by adjusting the "Offset Term," "Linear Term," and "Quad. Term" located on the left half of the tools tab under the Calibration tab.

div: To graphically recalibrate a spectrum, right-click on the original energy and drag to the desired modified energy. Once complete, a small window will pop up prompting you to accept the calibration changes you are attempting to incur; on this window you can manually adjust the energy quantities either by 1) directly entering the values into the appropriate boxes, or 2) ticking the arrows for a 1keV perturbation at the upper energy range of the spectrum; once it has been calibrated sufficiently select Accept on the bottom of the pop up window.

div.ul: If you have multiple calibrations, check/uncheck the previous calibrations you would like to keep in effect at the bottom of the pop-up window(s).
